snippet: An old plant has become an example of how a modest-size Rust Belt manufacturer can find its niche in an increasingly global automotive industry.
abstract: AM General celebrates first production of Mercedes-Benz sport utility vehicle at sprawling Indiana factory that sat idle for years following GM's 2009 bankruptcy; vehicles will be manufactured for Chinese consumers, and resurrection of factory illustrates how increasingly global automotive industry can bring new opportunities to rust belt.

byline.contributor: Aaron M. Kessler contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: An old plant has become an example of how a modest-size Rust Belt manufacturer can find its niche in an increasingly global automotive industry.

headline.main: In Former Hummer Plant in Indiana, Mercedes Turns Out S.U.V.s for China
headline.print_headline: Global Trade Revives an Auto Factory Gone Silent in Indiana
